column1: An exonym is a place name
column2: used by non-natives of that place
column3: that differs from the official or native name for that place. Turkish has a wealth of exonyms in areas beyond the current borders of Turkey notably those that were once part of Ottoman Empire and its vassals and tributaries or within the Turkish
column5: or a Turkic sphere of cultural or economic influence. In addition
column6: Turkish sometimes renders the names of other cities in a phonetic Turkish spelling
column8: Chicago as Şikago or Manchester as Mançester.  As these forms are not commonly used in Turkish
column9: there is not a systematic attempt to include them here.

column1: Cities are grouped by country and then listed alphabetically by their current best-known name in English. The English version is followed by Turkish variants in order of significance. A blue asterisk generally indicates the availability of a Turkish Wikipedia article for that city under that name which may also provide additional reference for the equivalence.
